toc_entry.title: Lifestyles Of the Rich And Bankrupt
toc_entry.description: Going broke is for poor people. Here’s a whole chapter of Texans who have found ways to clear the books without losing their ranches, Rolls, or Rolexes.

toc_entry.title: The Man Who Crushed Texaco
toc_entry.description: Judges take his money. Juries buy his bull. And when clients like Pennzoil need a tiger in their tank, they hire Joe Jamail.

toc_entry.title: Who Can Stop the Killer Bees?
toc_entry.description: Experts predict the first swarms could cross the border next year. What happens then to Texas’ multimillion-dollar honey industry is anybody’s guess.

toc_entry.title: Should This Man Be President?
toc_entry.description: For all his integrity and noble intentions, George Bush has yet to prove he’s got the agenda of a true statesman.

toc_entry.title: Texas In the Blood!
toc_entry.description: Descendants of famous Texans like Sam Houston and Davy Crockett don’t even try to fill their forefathers’ shoes. They just do their best to keep them polished.

toc_entry.title: Saturday Night Live
toc_entry.description: When it’s time to step out, real-life clotheshorses can always dig deep in their closets for something nervy and bold.

toc_entry.title: Disorder In the Court
toc_entry.subtitle: Politics
toc_entry.description: An eleventh-hour filing by two candidates for the state Supreme Court has kicked off a season of judicial campaigning unprecedented in Texas history.

toc_entry.title: Paradise MaÑAna
toc_entry.subtitle: Travel
toc_entry.description: If the brand-spanking-new Mexican beach resort of Huatulco is what you’ve been waiting for, then keep waiting.

toc_entry.title: Pleasant Under Glass
toc_entry.subtitle: Architecture
toc_entry.description: The exuberant crystal towers above San antonio’s botanical conservatory have captured everyone’s attention. Inside, it’s even better.

toc_entry.title: The Soft Sell
toc_entry.subtitle: Books
toc_entry.description: Once, the term “paperback original” was reserved for second-rate work. Now, thanks to an innovative editor, two Texas novelists are proud to see their books in softcover.

toc_entry.title: The Roar Of the Crowd
toc_entry.description: Perceptions of power; battling counselors; bum raps; good and evil and the church.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective guide to amusements and events.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: Grazing cheap and chic in Houston, austin, and Dallas; tire-kicking at the Fizzlick liquidation boutique; returning a piece of Janis’ heart to Port arthur.

toc_entry.title: The National Tour Of Texas
toc_entry.description: A glowing beacon near Haynesville; broomweed royalties in Foard County; archer City’s decorated dump; curative waters and a grand hotel in Mineral Wells; faux alamo in Farmersville.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: Bubba beats the new truck safety standards; o’neill loses at Baylor—again; Bush’s loss is Gramm’s gain; Clements stays tough on spending.
